topic.title: Learn X in Y minutes
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1XinYeo9fCjP5VrayvR6iBMzyyWWq963J/

A mirror of https://learnxinyminutes.com . Provides short, scenic tours of programming languages with working example code and translations into several languages.

1566570350_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body:
> [humboldt](#comment_10_1A3HXsg9nYdffV3gBNDN5NDpdZE1xBq8Ra): How to cure the socialism infection: [...]

This wouldn't do anything until it was done to the people at the top of society. Current tax laws hurt the middle class more than the upper class, who can afford to evade or find loopholes in tax laws.

1568598626_1MfahbRQx2DvKRccN57nhFZvYmfir.body:
> [trustedleanings](#comment_7_1MfahbRQx2DvKRccN57nhFZvYmfirQfZeX): [...] what risk is there really if i'm seeding other peoples shady content? I didn't sign it, am I really responsible for it?

See @randomshifts, but unless you get raided by triple letter agency for another reason, it is unlikely that anyone will find out your identity if you only use that box for hosting and not personal use.

1568753767_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: It allows for true freedom of speech. Anyone can say what they want, and if a group is shunned on one platform, they can click clone and make a new one.

1568856272_1MfahbRQx2DvKRccN57nhFZvYmfir.body: The issue is that no one has visited or downloaded your site. To get peers, put the link on this site: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/, or post the link on forums.

1569165906_1FXFTPnN5etVrX3KURv61vEEbEqay.body: Waiting on "Please wait until someone wants to play"

> [gitcenter](#comment_1087_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): What game are you playing? Tic-tac-toe?

Yes.

1567752163_1D6UcmziWg55aXV6TnCksXpjsFJ4g.body: I've found that https://github.com/klynastor/supervanitygen is about twice as fast as the default vanitygen.

1571905302_112M71AbhUCyq3M7k8PLDRdELuQKG.body: Yes, they removed the firefox proxy settings menu in about:preferences entirely. To bypass this, set network.proxy.no_proxies_on in about:config to "127.0.0.1, localhost".

1571858911_18Qiw35UQuh8sSnqksUbQQh1SGaC3.body:
Copied and pasted from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OFFSystem :

"The client OFFLoad is a fork from mainline OFF, which seemingly adds no features. Reasons for the fork are unclear."

This is a fork of offsystem that doesn't add any useful features.

1571938147_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
> [colorizer](#comment_5_18WM5x3GZasMoFrmEAZcZ2rtQvq9Fue1MZ): I know that PHP working by creating HTML/CSS/javascript pages to respond to commmand obtained by PC clients....is a client-server language and must work on a server. how can it work on zeronet? [...]

You could either replace the comment system completely, or use something like this https://github.com/asmblah/uniter to use (some of) the current commenting system on the user's computer.

1572051069_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: Porting sites without javascript/php would be relatively easy, sites with javascript/php could range from easy to extremely hard. (i.e. minified javascript that downloads content from the server on the fly) For most non-static sites, manual work will need to be done to port them properly.

1572293998_1GGZUdrWYgPgvqiA1mo4TxHFKvCw4.body:
From the issue linked by @flips and @apostolou :

1. Start Tor Browser.
2. Browse to about:config.
3. Enter network.proxy.no_proxies_on into the "Search:" box.
4. Double-click the network.proxy.no_proxies_on line that appears.
5. Enter 127.0.0.1 as the value of this preference.
6. Click "OK".

1572836262_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: On zeronet, there are [BloxelWars](http://127.0.0.1:43110/143TbAqxkbJsYtLnMSkAKjyJoQmFhp1cDR/) and [ZPlace](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1D6f2CvDRhPeEeBAcmqGt3X9z2CkLpmv2V), with BloxelWars being the more mature of the two.

> [xcape2net](#comment_532_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): After going to BloxelWars, my computer locked up and I had to re-install the operating system.  I'm pretty sure BloxelWars is malware.

What os/browser are you using? From what I can tell, BloxelWars makes no requests outside of zeronet, and it doesn't crash my machine.

1573658191_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body:
> [goodafternoon](#comment_13_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4vKLfY3): If someone brings over the entire site to zero net ill seed it. I remember reading these, it was a nice community.

I'm going to work on making a mirror. Be warned, though, it could end up being larger than a gigabyte.

1574042302_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4v.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_1120_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Just added that spammer to my spamlist. [...]

He has been spamming [Big Kopy Kate 2](http://127.0.0.1:43110/15GACn5cumjT2RsN7NjfnUYuM2a96xN5aD) with dreamraffle@cryptoid.bit

1574322103_1D5iCU5XE1D25ce2fV2XZqH95jGRt.body: Tor browser recently removed the "No proxy for" setting in about:preferences, and the docs still haven't updated to provide working instructions. See [this thread](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1572293998_1GGZUdrWYgPgvqiA1mo4TxHFKvCw4g99rK/Tor+Browser+9+0+removes+no+proxy+for+setting) for how to get around it.

1574369336_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: Your best bet for getting seeders (and keeping the files alive) is to upload to a more popular video-sharing site such as [Big KopyKate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit). If you want to make an independent site, all you have to do is include the files in the site directory, and embed them in the html. See [Techonocracy](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TechgqQHqAjmKKQunAJqaritGH9mWNQS/).

1574358520_17DxbCXzmCiauR7nrdYcornB3DNKZ.body:
> [maciejplwroclaw2](#comment_3_17DxbCXzmCiauR7nrdYcornB3DNKZYrheM): I dont really much care about anonimity, i would like mine website to be available  when mine pc is down and accessed from general internet.

On Zeronet, when someone visits your website, they will save the files necessary to display it onto their computer. When a new person wants to visit your website, anyone's Zeronet installation that has your site may upload it to the new person's computer. Unfortunately, most of the general-internet-to-zeronet servers are down, and the ones that are up are unreliable at best, so your site will be difficult to access from the general internet.

1574608306_12wtYTT9hC5Y8a2QMDmVS6bs3gNje.body:
> [654asd](#comment_1_12wtYTT9hC5Y8a2QMDmVS6bs3gNjeK8z1p): <a href=javascript:alert(1)>

If you would like to experiment with bugs in ZeroTalk, please clone it by clicking the triple-dot icon next to ZeroTalk in ZeroHello, and clicking clone. Then, open "myZeroTalk" and experiment in there.

1574586444_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body:
> [1bfqutudhtexlka](#comment_53_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2EhuAY): it always installs as tor browser , there is no information on tor site on how to install it on linux , also can't find the /etc/tor/torrc

Try running this:
$ sudo apt-get install tor
$ sudo systemctl restart tor
If systemctl runs silently, you have tor installed and running, and should be able to configure ZeroNet to use it.

> [1bfqutudhtexlka](#comment_58_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2EhuAY): sudo: systemctl: command not found

Try running
$ tor
in the command line

1574709000_17HiBFxSUskJt5VznGAVq8bxsqqkj.body:
In the file zeronet.conf (either at /etc/zeronet.conf or in the ZeroNet-py3 directory), change
data_dir = (default directory)
to 
data_dir = (your directory here)
and move everything to the new directory.

> [pyrophilia](#comment_5_17HiBFxSUskJt5VznGAVq8bxsqqkjwjWsR): Should have specified I'm on windows...  Although I have a linux box. maybe I should use it on here.

I don't know where zeronet.conf is on windows, maybe do some digging around on your system or ask someone else.

1574802501_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
> [filips](#comment_327_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Which browser and system do you use? What does this site says about your WebGL support?
> [styromaniac](#comment_1342_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It's still there. Something is inadequate or missing on your system.

I'm on IceCat (a close fork of firefox), and the globe was there a week ago, and it now says "WebGL not supported". It may be the new revision. I'll test some other browsers.

> [filips](#comment_327_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Which browser and system do you use? What does this site says about your WebGL support?
FireFox, Tor Browser, and pale moon work fine. WebGL seems to have thrown a TypeError. Here's the error message it gave me in the console:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj_0 (NullPaste)

> [filips](#comment_328_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Do you have any addons that might disable JS/WebGL? What does WebGL report page says?

Nevermind. IceCat has WebGL disabled by default, and I hadn't enabled it. Works fine after it is enabled.

> [xcape2net](#comment_573_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Which webgl flag did you reset?

I didn't change any webgl flags. IceCat provides a convenient checkbox on it's new tab page. I tested using a fully updated Tor Browser, and it worked fine, so maybe consider updating. Running an old version makes you easier to fingerprint, and there might be security holes that don't exist in newer versions, but you will [have to mess with no_proxy_for settings manually](https://zeronet.io/docs/faq/#how-to-use-zeronet-with-the-tor-browser). (I would link to zeronet mirror of docs, but they haven't been updated with this information)

1575050171_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body: You can change a lot of zeronet interfaces to dark mode by clicking the triple-dot icon next to "Hello ZeroNet_" on the home page, and clicking "dark" under theme.

1575374057_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body: There are also [ZeroTorrents](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/) and [Torrent Share](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ShArE1dJFcHFgTEEAUMXksDZuRckzd3Y/), which allow you to upload torrents, and are fully decentralized.

1575755429_1DfbNohg1UZxEJXMGS4W46bSSh3Ag.body: Check out [this site](https://zero.acelewis.com/). It redirects users to a working zeronet proxy, a server that allows users to view zeronet over a normal internet connection.

> [filips](#comment_335_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): You can set up public proxy that just hosts your website and make it accessible from clearnet.

Yeah, we need more public proxies. Currently, zero.acelewis.com seems to only redirect to 0net.io, and according to [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:proxies), 0net.io is the only public proxy online.

> [nsm](#comment_11_1DfbNohg1UZxEJXMGS4W46bSSh3AgzmJ4r): I need to host my site here, to edit it, to update it and to add new post. But i would like to know if it's possibile to link my zeronet blog hosting with my clearnet domain so everyone can read it. Sorry for my english. Thank you.

It is possible to make a clearnet link to your site. Just go to https://zero.acelewis.com , paste your site's address into "Create link meta proxy link to share with others" and click "Make Link". The link that replaces your site's address is a clearnet link to your zeronet site.

1575790343_19xaGWaZg4koHQTrXtqdaM58To7cn.body:
> [oijsdcpouqwdhco](#comment_1_19xaGWaZg4koHQTrXtqdaM58To7cneR1d8): can you see my ip ?

Your post isn't associated with your ip address even in normal mode. Tor mode prevents your ip from being leaked when you seed or download content.

1575935042_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6.body:
> [reichardnixon](#comment_82_16NfWw2hgzGaVcQs35UJySKMf4YP9kZFbr): uj3wazyk5u4hnvtk.onion

I'm pretty sure their official onion address is http://piratebayztemzmv.onion (it's linked on http://thepiratebay.org), both of which are up.

> [0010001100100001](#comment_6_1SNukFwksAnncCiRAnG4996tagosfhSE4): Looks like it's accomplished using https://baystream.co/. I'm curious how they are doing it. What is the technology behind the scenes?



>[clearnet15bad](): It surely uses webtorrent.

[link](https://webtorrent.io/faq)

1576018469_1PE7nD7YtXWzNdc1EggdBPaqWTYs6.body: Tor browser does save bookmarks, since they require user consent and don't compromise anonymity.

1576012034_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4v.body:
> [0010001100100001](#comment_13_1SNukFwksAnncCiRAnG4996tagosfhSE4): Here is the torrent for it  [...]

Put the text you want to link in square brackets, and the address in parenthesis immediately after, [like] (this), but without the space.
When I run play.py after installing all libraries and the model, it says "Initailizing AI Dungeon!", then freezes my system for a few seconds before bash kills it.

> [fractalzoomer](#comment_41_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYEKgAFj): When I run play.py after installing all libraries and the model, it says "Initailizing AI Dungeon!", then freezes my system for a few seconds before bash kills it.

Nevermind, its because I don't have enough ram. You need 12gb to run it.

1576021217_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: The hidden service that Saxon's Book Repository depends on seems to be down. :(

1576135007_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
It seems that Iran did this already a few weeks ago. Some articles detailing it:

https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/17/iran-shuts-down-countrys-internet-in-the-wake-of-fuel-protests/
https://www.voanews.com/middle-east/voa-news-iran/irans-internet-shutdown-extends-5th-day-further-harming-economy

1576192907_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: From my experience, it will never use more than one core, and idles at a small fraction of a core. It appears to use ~16 threads.

> [styromaniac](#comment_1420_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): You have 16 threads per core?

No, sorry. It runs 16 processes, not 16 threads.

1576434866_1CJc7iRKb8yncAkdF29t1M85mhfYE.body:
> [22igor](#comment_2_1EzNhcaq8eqsamfqobDECK6cEV52k5hF54): no peers found

It could take a minute for it to be well peered, since I am hosting through tor.

> [filips](#comment_361_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Some links still redirect you to original site. You should fix this.

Which ones? I downloaded it with 'wget -k', so they should have been converted.

> [filips](#comment_362_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Page with python3 guide has link "check out here" which links to python2 guide but on original site. And other pages may also have similar problems.

Thanks for pointing it out to me. I'll look into it.

> [filips](#comment_362_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Page with python3 guide has link "check out here" which links to python2 guide but on original site. And other pages may also have similar problems.

I have no idea why wget only fails to convert some links. There are just over one hundred which failed to convert, which exist in both http and https urls, and other links that are apparently just like them are converted (i.e. the [french version of that article](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1XinYeo9fCjP5VrayvR6iBMzyyWWq963J/docs/fr-fr/python-fr/index.html)). Do you know of good software to programmatically change these links for me?

> [filips](#comment_365_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Maybe wget just converted URLs in main index.html file?

No, the big link at the top of each page works, and the link to the french python2 article works in [the french python3 article](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1XinYeo9fCjP5VrayvR6iBMzyyWWq963J/docs/fr-fr/python-fr/index.html). I think I'm going to use hxcopy to convert every link to an absolute link. It's not ideal, but it should work.
Ok, I'm pretty sure that the only links pointing to the clearnet now are 404's on their server, try it out to make sure.

> [weakish](#comment_12_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR): Learn X in Y minutes is open source. So an alternative way  to download it via wget is clone the repo and build the site locally on your machine, then upload it to ZeroNet. Instructions

Thank you! This will let me modify the site much easier.

> [randomshits](#comment_301_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): Well it was working... now the links go nowhere for me.

When you hover over the links, where does it say they go? Are you using 127.0.0.1:43110 as your zeronet host?

> [randomshits](#comment_302_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): It seems the '127.0.0.1:43110/1XinYeo9fCjP5VrayvR6iBMzyyWWq963J/docs/es-es/asymptotic-notation-es/index.html' are absolute paths and I can't access it through a proxy. [...]

Try it now. All the links are in the form /1XinY...963J/docs/es-es/asymptotic-notation-es/index.html , because links like /docs/es-es/asymptotic-notation-es/index.html send you to 127.0.0.1:43110/docs/es-es/asymptotic-notation-es/index.html , and zeronet doesn't know what to do with that.

1577159364_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body: [The docs](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#do-i-need-to-have-a-port-opened) say, "If you want to create a new site it's highly recommended to have an open port", so you should be able to publish a site without opening a port. Failing that, you can always publish through tor.

1577725951_12BRJSQrTETJVZzt2jHdqPywv3Sdu.body: The 50k limit is only meant to prevent spam and to prevent other users from using too much disk space on your computer.
